[ir8rer4Telegram from Civil Commissioner, Baghdad, to Secretary of State,dated 18th September 1920.I visited Ramadi by air on 15th September returning same day and interviewed leading chief. Situation in this division has improved. ' Insurgents have made their maximum effort and further additions to their strength are (? improbable). This is I think also true of the situation in Mesopotamia as a whole, and there is good reason to think that, provided that military (? measures) now (? in) progress or in contemplation during the next fortnight are successful, as 1 have no doubt they will be, there will be a steady change for the better, arid that by the middle or the end of October affairs will be ripe for a settlement, vide General Officer Commanding-in-(? Chiefs) telegram of 21st August, X. 9895.2320 SECRET.
CABINET.
REPORT ON REVOLUTIONARY ORGANISATIONS IN THE UNITED KINGDOM
No. 73 (C.P.1885)
It is requested that this document may be treated as highly confidential.
2, Whitehall Gardens. S.W.
25th September 1920.
